snippet: Mr. Frankel had his widest audience when he hosted a one-hour nightly show on WABC-FM, “Music From Around the World,” which aired from 1959 to 1972.
abstract: Erwin Frankel, radio host and concert promoter who helped bring world music to the United States, dies at age 76.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Frankel had his widest audience when he hosted a one-hour nightly show on WABC-FM, “Music From Around the World,” which aired from 1959 to 1972.

headline.seo: Erwin Frankel Dies at 76; Introduced the U.S. to World Music
headline.main: Erwin Frankel Dies at 76; Brought World Music to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Erwin Frankel, 76; Brought World Music to the United States
